Posted By: True_Smog (11/18/2009 10:08:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I ordered 20 [Snow-Covered Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snow-Covered Swamp)s and 4 of this guy to replace my [Drudge Skeletons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drudge Skeletons). This guy and [Fog of Gnats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fog of Gnats) have really made my deck for me early game. After having played both this and Drudgies, I don't understand why this is rated lower then the later. This is my favorite one drop in the game by far.
posts.html:

Posted By: Bursama (11/20/2010 3:36:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Holy crap, how are people not rating this higher?  
  
It's a one-drop 1/1 with regeneration, which in anybody's book should be awesome. To top that off, the activation cost for the regeneration ability isn't even color-specific, it's just snow-specific. With the {B} casting cost that makes this guy easily splashable; the only thing you'd have to do is make sure most if not all of your other lands are of the snow-covered variety, and snow-covered basic lands are *not* expensive by any measure. Hell, there are even dual snow lands if you don't want to screw up your mana variety, e.g. [Tresserhorn Sinks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tresserhorn Sinks).  
  
[Will-o'-the-Wisp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Will-o'-the-Wisp) is still better because it's a one-drop regenerator with flying, but it's a very close thing. This guy is a close second, or possibly tied for second.
posts.html:
Holy crap, how are people not rating this higher?

It's a one-drop 1/1 with regeneration, which in anybody's book should be awesome. To top that off, the activation cost for the regeneration ability isn't even color-specific, it's just snow-specific. With the {B} casting cost that makes this guy easily splashable; the only thing you'd have to do is make sure most if not all of your other lands are of the snow-covered variety, and snow-covered basic lands are not expensive by any measure. Hell, there are even dual snow lands if you don't want to screw up your mana variety, e.g. Tresserhorn Sinks.

Will-o'-the-Wisp is still better because it's a one-drop regenerator with flying, but it's a very close thing. This guy is a close second, or possibly tied for second.
